result.execSummary:
The defendant Bailey E Kraus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: Agency
superAgency.notes: See conditions as listed on DAA.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall report to the Winnebago County Jail for fingerprinting and photo pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7).

Defendant shall submit a payment with amount deemed appropriate by the agent on a monthly basis.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Expungement shall be granted if in compliance with Wisconsin Statute Section 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bailey E Kraus in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to revocation of DAA.  Defendant found guilty.
Defendant Bailey E Kraus in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Stephanie Ann Stauber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bailey E Kraus in court.  Michael J. Balskus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for representation.  Hearing adjourned.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Motion hearing on October 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion To Revoke DAA and Order To Toll Time Limits filed by DA's office.
Defendant Bailey E Kraus in court.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State withdraws motion to revoke DAA.  State moves for an extension - granted.  New discharge date is 11/24/16.
Motion and Order to Revoke DAA and Order to Toll Time Limits
Deferred Adjudication Agreement = 12 months.    The bond is lifted and no longer in effect.
Defendant Bailey E Kraus in court.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
